name: Path T Orbit
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  The orbital tissues are the support systems of the globe, confined to the space within the surrounding bony structure.  The tissues include fat, striated and smooth muscle, and fibroconnective, vascular, lymphoid, peripheral nerve, and optic nerve tissue.

**Note 2:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for orbit sarcoma tumors.

**Note 3:**  Tis may be used only for non-sarcoma histologies coded to this site. Sarcomas do not present as in situ or noninvasive tumors.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Surgical resection of primary tumor done, size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary
Tumor 15 mm or less in greatest dimension

Confined to orbit
Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor more than 15 mm in greatest dimension 
WITHOUT invasion of globe or bony wall

Tumor of any size 
WITH invasion of orbital tissues and/or bony walls

Tumor invades: 
    Globe or periorbital structure, such as 
        Eyelids 
        Temporal fossa
        Nasal cavity 
        Paranasal sinuses 
        Central nervous system (CNS)

Cranium
    
Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Pathologic T is not defined for the specific site/histology
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
